subject: Productivity
title: Structured Procrastination
description: A quick win: understand Structured Procrastination.

hook.text: Philosopher John Perry won an Ig Nobel Prize for arguing that procrastination can be productive.

buildup.text: Structured procrastination means putting a daunting task at the top of your list â€” then avoiding it.

discovery.text: While avoiding the top task, you naturally complete everything else on the list.

twist.text: It's a clever trick on yourself. The tasks you accomplish feel like procrastination but are real work.

climax.text: Perry admits it's imperfect. But it harnesses avoidance instead of fighting it.

punchline.text: Procrastinate on one thing. Finish everything else.

quiz.question: What is structured procrastination?
options: Using avoidance of one big task to complete smaller ones
